name: House
description: Generally features a four-on-the-floor beat within 110-140â€¯BPM, a groove built on swing and syncopation, synthesized basslines, repetitive melodic elements, and an upbeat mood.

children.name: Acid House
children.description: Emerged in the mid-1980s, characterised by repetitive basslines created with the distinctive modulated "squelching" sound of the Roland TB-303 synthesiser.

children.name: Acid House
children.description: Emerged in the mid-1980s, characterised by repetitive basslines created with the distinctive modulated "squelching" sound of the Roland TB-303 synthesiser.

children.name: Afro House
children.description: Emerged by fusing Deep House with Southern African Music, characterized by hypnotizing drum patterns of shakers and congas, often sampled African vocals or soulful original features, and spiritual, organic, melodic atmosphere.

children.name: Afro House
children.description: Emerged by fusing Deep House with Southern African Music, characterized by hypnotizing drum patterns of shakers and congas, often sampled African vocals or soulful original features, and spiritual, organic, melodic atmosphere.

children.name: Amapiano
children.description: House from South Africa deriving from previous popular genres including Gqom, Kwaito, and Deep House.

children.name: Amapiano
children.description: House from South Africa deriving from previous popular genres including Gqom, Kwaito, and Deep House.

children.name: Ambient House
children.description: Primarily British genre developed in the 1990s with beats, synthesizers, and vocals in styles similar to House, treated with effects that are often described as "dream-like" or "chilled out".

children.name: Ambient House
children.description: Primarily British genre developed in the 1990s with beats, synthesizers, and vocals in styles similar to House, treated with effects that are often described as "dream-like" or "chilled out".

children.name: Ballroom
children.description: Emerging from the predominantly Black and LGBT Harlem ballroom culture, it is characterized by hard-hitting rhythms, generally improvised chanting by MCs known as commentators, and a distinctive crash sample.

children.name: Ballroom
children.description: Emerging from the predominantly Black and LGBT Harlem ballroom culture, it is characterized by hard-hitting rhythms, generally improvised chanting by MCs known as commentators, and a distinctive crash sample.

children.name: Baltimore Club
children.description: Drew on the "booty bass" syncopation of Miami Bass, combined with Breakbeat rhythms around 130 BPM and chopped up vocal samples as found in Ghetto House.

children.name: Baltimore Club
children.description: Drew on the "booty bass" syncopation of Miami Bass, combined with Breakbeat rhythms around 130 BPM and chopped up vocal samples as found in Ghetto House.

children.name: Bass House
children.description: Busy, punchy percussion, prominent basslines and dirty, distorted synths resembling other bass music genres, with influences including Brostep, Fidget House, Bassline, Speed Garage, and Tech House.

children.name: Bass House
children.description: Busy, punchy percussion, prominent basslines and dirty, distorted synths resembling other bass music genres, with influences including Brostep, Fidget House, Bassline, Speed Garage, and Tech House.

children.name: Bassline
children.description: Strong emphasis on intricate basslines as well as four-on-the-floor beat patterns.

children.name: Bassline
children.description: Strong emphasis on intricate basslines as well as four-on-the-floor beat patterns.

children.name: Big Room House
children.description: Energetic, festival-oriented style characterized by heavy reverb, intense build-ups, strong kicks, minimalistic drop melodies, and sparse, raw breakdowns.

children.name: Big Room House
children.description: Energetic, festival-oriented style characterized by heavy reverb, intense build-ups, strong kicks, minimalistic drop melodies, and sparse, raw breakdowns.

children.name: Brazilian Bass
children.description: Originated in the 2010s in Brazil, taking influences from Deep House and Tech House, characterized by deep, punchy basslines making use of detuning and filtering effects.

children.name: Brazilian Bass
children.description: Originated in the 2010s in Brazil, taking influences from Deep House and Tech House, characterized by deep, punchy basslines making use of detuning and filtering effects.

children.name: Bubbling House
children.description: Developed in the Netherlands in the 2000s, combining the older style of Bubbling with more modern House, especially Dutch House.

children.name: Bubbling House
children.description: Developed in the Netherlands in the 2000s, combining the older style of Bubbling with more modern House, especially Dutch House.

children.name: Changa tuki
children.description: Emerged in Caracas; highly influenced by 1990s Techno and Tribal House, featuring fast tempos, strident synthesizers, hard-thumping percussion lines, and plenty of breakbeats.

children.name: Changa tuki
children.description: Emerged in Caracas; highly influenced by 1990s Techno and Tribal House, featuring fast tempos, strident synthesizers, hard-thumping percussion lines, and plenty of breakbeats.

children.name: Chicago Hard House
children.description: Originated from Chicago around the mid-1990s as a development of Ghetto House, emphasizing hard-hitting, off-beat drum patterns, fast tempos, and lack of melodies.

children.name: Chicago Hard House
children.description: Originated from Chicago around the mid-1990s as a development of Ghetto House, emphasizing hard-hitting, off-beat drum patterns, fast tempos, and lack of melodies.

children.name: Chicago House
children.description: Umbrella term for a broad variety of House that originated from Chicago in the (mostly mid-to-late) 1980s and early 90s.

children.name: Chicago House
children.description: Umbrella term for a broad variety of House that originated from Chicago in the (mostly mid-to-late) 1980s and early 90s.

children.name: Deep House
children.description: Emerged in the United States during the mid-1980s, featuring a relaxed tempo and influences from Jazz, Funk, and Soul.

children.name: Deep House
children.description: Emerged in the United States during the mid-1980s, featuring a relaxed tempo and influences from Jazz, Funk, and Soul.

children.name: Diva House
children.description: Dominant, anthemic female vocals, common use of piano stabs, and energetic, driving four-on-the-floor rhythms.

children.name: Diva House
children.description: Dominant, anthemic female vocals, common use of piano stabs, and energetic, driving four-on-the-floor rhythms.

children.name: Electro House
children.description: Warm analog basslines, punchy percussion, crisp high-pitched synthesizer leads, and clipped vocal samples.

children.name: Electro House
children.description: Warm analog basslines, punchy percussion, crisp high-pitched synthesizer leads, and clipped vocal samples.

children.name: Eletrofunk
children.description: Blends Funk brasileiro vocals with production from popular late 2000s and early 2010s House.

children.name: Eletrofunk
children.description: Blends Funk brasileiro vocals with production from popular late 2000s and early 2010s House.

children.name: Euro House
children.description: Vocal-focused style emerging in the late 1980s in Europe, developing in parallel with Eurodance.

children.name: Euro House
children.description: Vocal-focused style emerging in the late 1980s in Europe, developing in parallel with Eurodance.

children.name: Festival Progressive House
children.description: Uplifting, melodic, energetic but clean drops, featuring modern supersaws and pianos, taking influences from Progressive House, Uplifting Trance, but applying them to a form structurally closer to Big Room House and Electro House.

children.name: Festival Progressive House
children.description: Uplifting, melodic, energetic but clean drops, featuring modern supersaws and pianos, taking influences from Progressive House, Uplifting Trance, but applying them to a form structurally closer to Big Room House and Electro House.

children.name: French House
children.description: Originated in France in the mid-1990s, characterized by the use of filtered (low-pass, phaser, etc.) samples of Funk and Disco.

children.name: French House
children.description: Originated in France in the mid-1990s, characterized by the use of filtered (low-pass, phaser, etc.) samples of Funk and Disco.

children.name: Funky House
children.description: Funky, warm, catchy basslines on top of looped Funk or Disco samples, resulting in an upbeat, bouncy, and pacy groove.

children.name: Funky House
children.description: Funky, warm, catchy basslines on top of looped Funk or Disco samples, resulting in an upbeat, bouncy, and pacy groove.

children.name: Future Funk
children.description: Sample-based form of House which formed out of Vaporwave in the early 2010s.

children.name: Future Funk
children.description: Sample-based form of House which formed out of Vaporwave in the early 2010s.

children.name: Future House
children.description: Features distinctive metallic-sounding drops and frequency-modulated basslines at around 120-130 BPM.

children.name: Future House
children.description: Features distinctive metallic-sounding drops and frequency-modulated basslines at around 120-130 BPM.

children.name: G-House
children.description: Deep, dark form of House music that primarily incorporates rap samples or original rapping on top of minimal, bassy beats.

children.name: G-House
children.description: Deep, dark form of House music that primarily incorporates rap samples or original rapping on top of minimal, bassy beats.

children.name: Garage House
children.description: Disco-influenced style of House that developed in the 1980s, incorporating elements of Gospel, Soul, and Dub, before evolving into a more upbeat style that prominently features crisp syncopated hi-hats and synth stabs.

children.name: Garage House
children.description: Disco-influenced style of House that developed in the 1980s, incorporating elements of Gospel, Soul, and Dub, before evolving into a more upbeat style that prominently features crisp syncopated hi-hats and synth stabs.

children.name: Ghetto House
children.description: Rough sound based around minimal drum machine-driven tracks and heavy usage of vocal samples.

children.name: Ghetto House
children.description: Rough sound based around minimal drum machine-driven tracks and heavy usage of vocal samples.

children.name: Gqom
children.description: Evolved from South African House, specifically Kwaito; often described as a more minimal and raw version.

children.name: Gqom
children.description: Evolved from South African House, specifically Kwaito; often described as a more minimal and raw version.

children.name: Hip House
children.description: Incorporates production elements of early Hip Hop and usually rapping into 1980s House.

children.name: Hip House
children.description: Incorporates production elements of early Hip Hop and usually rapping into 1980s House.

children.name: Italo House
children.description: Originated in Italy during the late 1980s, making use of anthemic pianos, diva vocals, and Dance-Pop song structures.

children.name: Italo House
children.description: Originated in Italy during the late 1980s, making use of anthemic pianos, diva vocals, and Dance-Pop song structures.

children.name: Jackin' House
children.description: Punchy, 'shuffly' percussion, strong grooves, funky basslines, and chopped-up samples.

children.name: Jackin' House
children.description: Punchy, 'shuffly' percussion, strong grooves, funky basslines, and chopped-up samples.

children.name: Kwaito
children.description: Emerged from South Africa in the early 1990s, taking influence from Disco and Hip Hop.

children.name: Kwaito
children.description: Emerged from South Africa in the early 1990s, taking influence from Disco and Hip Hop.

children.name: Latin House
children.description: Incorporates elements of Latin music (various Hispanic American Music and Brazilian Music genres), including their melodies, vocals, and instruments, as well as additional Latin percussion.

children.name: Latin House
children.description: Incorporates elements of Latin music (various Hispanic American Music and Brazilian Music genres), including their melodies, vocals, and instruments, as well as additional Latin percussion.

children.name: Melodic House
children.description: Arpeggiated synth lines, focus on a chilled and laid-back atmosphere, and influence from genres such as Progressive House and Deep House.

children.name: Melodic House
children.description: Arpeggiated synth lines, focus on a chilled and laid-back atmosphere, and influence from genres such as Progressive House and Deep House.

children.name: Microhouse
children.description: Stripped-down, minimal form of House, originating in the late 90s, which takes influence from Minimal Techno, Glitch and IDM.

children.name: Microhouse
children.description: Stripped-down, minimal form of House, originating in the late 90s, which takes influence from Minimal Techno, Glitch and IDM.

children.name: Organic House
children.description: Subtle drums and grooves, slow tempos, and acoustic, traditional instrumentation, resulting in an organic, warm sound and spiritual atmosphere.

children.name: Organic House
children.description: Subtle drums and grooves, slow tempos, and acoustic, traditional instrumentation, resulting in an organic, warm sound and spiritual atmosphere.

children.name: Outsider House
children.description: Mostly derived from Deep House; intentional use of rough, lo-fi production, often utilizing a mix of analog/analog-like and digital instrumentation.

children.name: Outsider House
children.description: Mostly derived from Deep House; intentional use of rough, lo-fi production, often utilizing a mix of analog/analog-like and digital instrumentation.

children.name: Phonk House
children.description: Merges Drift Phonk's nocturnal atmospheres, cowbell melodies, vocal samples, and energetic production, with House rhythms and tempos, characterized by a banging and upbeat sound.

children.name: Phonk House
children.description: Merges Drift Phonk's nocturnal atmospheres, cowbell melodies, vocal samples, and energetic production, with House rhythms and tempos, characterized by a banging and upbeat sound.

children.name: Progressive House
children.description: Trance-influenced strain of House that grew to prominence in the early 1990s, using polished production and gradual progressions.

children.name: Progressive House
children.description: Trance-influenced strain of House that grew to prominence in the early 1990s, using polished production and gradual progressions.

children.name: Romanian Popcorn
children.description: Emerged in the second half of the 2000s in Romania, often featuring brass melodies and "staccato" pluck grooves.

children.name: Romanian Popcorn
children.description: Emerged in the second half of the 2000s in Romania, often featuring brass melodies and "staccato" pluck grooves.

children.name: Speed Garage
children.description: Primarily British style that paved the way for UK Garage, combining cut-up vocal samples and sped up four-on-the-floor Garage House rhythms with Jungle-esque basslines.

children.name: Speed Garage
children.description: Primarily British style that paved the way for UK Garage, combining cut-up vocal samples and sped up four-on-the-floor Garage House rhythms with Jungle-esque basslines.

children.name: Stutter House
children.description: Emerged in the 2020s taking influences from Melodic House, Trance, and Future Garage; features distinctive chopping of vocal samples and pads.

children.name: Stutter House
children.description: Emerged in the 2020s taking influences from Melodic House, Trance, and Future Garage; features distinctive chopping of vocal samples and pads.

children.name: Tech House
children.description: Emerged in the mid-1990s taking influences from Techno, broadly characterized by minimalistic and repetitive melodies, focus on the bassline, and constant groove recognizable by prominent off-beat hi-hats.

children.name: Tech House
children.description: Emerged in the mid-1990s taking influences from Techno, broadly characterized by minimalistic and repetitive melodies, focus on the bassline, and constant groove recognizable by prominent off-beat hi-hats.

children.name: Tribal House
children.description: Prominent, syncopated rhythms of tribal drums such as toms and bongos on top of a House beat, usually resulting in a percussive, energetic sound, while ranging in mood.

children.name: Tribal House
children.description: Prominent, syncopated rhythms of tribal drums such as toms and bongos on top of a House beat, usually resulting in a percussive, energetic sound, while ranging in mood.

children.name: Tropical House
children.description: Offshoot of Deep House featuring slow tempos around 100-115 BPM, light percussion and acoustic instrumentation, setting out to create a relaxed, summery, beach-like atmosphere.

children.name: Tropical House
children.description: Offshoot of Deep House featuring slow tempos around 100-115 BPM, light percussion and acoustic instrumentation, setting out to create a relaxed, summery, beach-like atmosphere.

children.name: UK Hard House
children.description: Defined by offbeat bass patterns, compressed 909-style drums, buildup-drop structures, hoover sounds, and tempos between 120 and 155 BPM.

children.name: UK Hard House
children.description: Defined by offbeat bass patterns, compressed 909-style drums, buildup-drop structures, hoover sounds, and tempos between 120 and 155 BPM.

children.name: UK Jackin'
children.description: Successor to British Bassline, characterized by strong basslines, dark atmospheres, and dominant grooves.

children.name: UK Jackin'
children.description: Successor to British Bassline, characterized by strong basslines, dark atmospheres, and dominant grooves.

children.name: Vinahouse
children.description: Fast-paced House popular in Vietnam, remixing Vietnamese melodies.

children.name: Vinahouse
children.description: Fast-paced House popular in Vietnam, remixing Vietnamese melodies.
